pr_title: Added configuration of macro cache size

timeline.message: Added configuration of macro cache size

timeline.bodyText: What about a warning somewhere in the logs to tell user that some macro are not in the cache ?
timeline.author: pi-r-p

replies.bodyText: This warning would be written every time a macro would be loaded once you reach the limit. Setting a Sensision metric with the number of cached macros is probably a better option.
replies.author: hbs

replies.bodyText: Indeed. With 10000 as default, I doubt this will happen too often.
replies.author: pi-r-p

timeline.message: Added metric for tracking the size of the WarpFleet macros cache
Added TTL enforcement for library macros and reporting metrics

timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Why not checking for overflow and not setting expiry if it overflows?
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason there is a sensision metric for the library and not for the repo?
timeline.author: ftence

replies.bodyText: Same question for logging evicted macros.
replies.author: ftence

replies.bodyText: Macros which are evicted upon loading of a jar will never get re-added. In the case of the repo, when ondemand is true the macros will get loaded anyway. The ondemand param is true by default so we could log eviction only when it is false.
replies.author: hbs

timeline.author: ftence
ftence

replies.bodyText: To avoid having weird comparison results if checking with >
replies.author: hbs
